content.description: This has a gymnastic start (consider using 2 locking carabiners on the first bolt!), followed by moderate ground, with a very thin, thrilling crux to a horizontal crack. Continue to the anchor straight above.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor. Advise taking a #1 Camalot for the moves above the 5th bolt.
content.location: Start from the top of the large, pointed boulder at the right base of Old Folks Wall.

content.description: Clip the first bolt; Traverse the initial bulge toward the left, then clip two more bolts before placing gear. Careful not to make placements in good spots where your hands & feet oughta go. The bad thing is a #4 Camalot would kind of fit in one key spot.
content.protection: Three bolts to start (advise using 2 locking carabiners on the 1st bolt), then a few small wired nuts, TCUs through #2 Camalot. Move to the anchors at the top.
content.location:
This route is between "

Gelding Years

" and "

Thriller

." Rappel 50 feet from the two-bolt anchor.

content.description:
This is a good beginners' route; also a quick way to reach the anchors above in order to top-rope the other more difficult routes.

Start in the alcove on the far right of the Old Folks Wall, move onto the slab, clip the first

two

bolts of "

Bulgaria

", and move right towards the corner. Place a piece or two before the chockstone finish.
content.protection: Camalots #0.5 through #3.5 (You will need #0.75, #1 & #2 for the top belay anchor). The final chockstone before the top can be easily girth-hitched with a long sling.
content.location:
This route is on the far right side of the wall. Descend as for "

Thriller

."

content.description:
A thin start (bolt) leads to the shelf. Climb the initial offwidth crack (crux), and continue upwards as the difficulty moderates. This may be harder for short people (like yours truly), 70 feet.

Although there is a bolt to protect the start, this is most definitely a trad route.
content.protection: Hand-sized through #6 Camalots. Belay at the gap at the top with a long sling through the king-sized chockstone, and a few finger-sized stoppers.
content.location: This route is in the middle of the wall. Descend from bolted anchors on alternate routes at the top.

content.description:
Mixed sport/trad. Surmount the gritty groove (bolt) beneath the second pitch of

American Crawl

, and place a large cam in said crack before standing erect. Protect the next moves to the second bolt with a cam or two behind the flake. Don't miss the comforting opportunity to reach

inside

Bunny Flake just past the 2nd bolt! Follow the remaining 3 bolts with delicate moves. Stem right to a diagonal ripple, place a medium cam at the horizontal, overlapping blob, and move up to the chained anchor. 70 feet.
content.protection: Five bolts; gear from a few small TCUs through a #5 Camalot will be comforting.
content.location: Look for the cottontail rabbit-shaped flake system. Rap straight down to the ground.

content.description: Climb onto the slab (#4 Friend or #3.5 Camalot), and continue up the face on sustained edges through a line of four bolts. The crux is at the bulge. This route might seem a bit hard for the grade... unless you're tall.
content.protection: Pro as mentioned above, quickdraws for four bolts, and cams for the top anchor (#0.75, #1, & #2 Camalots).
content.location:
This route is the rightmost line of bolts on the Old Folks Wall. Descend using the anchors atop "

Thriller

."

content.description:
Pitch 1: Climb gritty blocks (on the far left) onto the 15-foot-high shelf which runs along the base of the wall; crawl to the right until one is able the stand erect upon the shelf at the vertical offwidth crack. Belay here - you'll have rope drag if you don't!

Pitch 2: Ascend the offwidth above, which eases considerably after the hand-sized section. Belay your second from the top of the crack.

A direct start, "

Crawl Direct

," (5.8) is possible by climbing the gritty, dirty groove (bolt) beneath the upper crack.

American Crawl

(solid line) with

Crawl Direct

option (dotted line).
content.protection:
Standard Vedauwoo Rack (stoppers through #6 Camalot). Rappel 70 feet from anchors atop "

The Bunny

," just to the northeast.
content.location: Leftmost obvious crack on the wall.
